question: Which of the following units is the smallest in terms of length?
explanation: Out of the given options, fermi is the smallest unit for measurement of distance. 1 micron = 10<sup>-6</sup> m 1 nanometre = 10<sup>-9</sup> m 1 angstrom = 10<sup>-10m 1 fermi = 10<sup>-15</sup>m The above four units are used for the measurement of small distances.
